meanings.definition: To move or proceed towards the west.
meanings.sent1: The sun begins to wester, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: We westered towards the beach to catch the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to wester across the room to find a sunny spot.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts westered back to the memories of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The river westered through the valley, reflecting the orange hues of the setting sun.

meanings.definition: A wind blowing from the west.
meanings.sent1: The wester brought a cool breeze on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: Sailors rely on the wester to guide their ships safely back to shore.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a mess when the wester blew away all the napkins.
meanings.sent4: The wester whispered secrets as it rustled through the leaves of the trees.
meanings.sent5: Children flew kites in the park, chasing the playful wester across the open field.
